getDensityInVeh

public java.lang.Double[] getDensityInVeh(int ensemble)
Density of vehicles per vehicle type in normalized units (vehicles/link/type). The return array is indexed by vehicle type in the order given in the settings portion of the input file.

Parameters:
ensemble - Ensemble number
Returns:
number of vehicles of each type in the link. null if something goes wrong.

getDensityInVeh

public double getDensityInVeh(int ensemble,
                              int vehicletype)
Number of vehicles for a given vehicle type in normalized units (vehicles/link).

Returns:
Number of vehicles of a given vehicle type in the link. 0 if something goes wrong.

getTotalDensityInVeh

public double getTotalDensityInVeh(int ensemble)
Total of vehicles in normalized units (vehicles/link). The return value equals the sum of getDensityInVeh(int).

Returns:
total number of vehicles in the link. 0 if something goes wrong.

getTotalDensityInVPM

public double getTotalDensityInVPM(int ensemble)
Total of vehicles in (vehicles/meter).

Returns:
total density of vehicles in the link. 0 if something goes wrong.

getOutflowInVeh

public java.lang.Double[] getOutflowInVeh(int ensemble)
Number of vehicles per vehicle type exiting the link during the current time step. The return array is indexed by vehicle type in the order given in the settings portion of the input file.

Returns:
array of exiting flows per vehicle type. null if something goes wrong.

getTotalOutflowInVeh

public double getTotalOutflowInVeh(int ensemble)
Total number of vehicles exiting the link during the current time step. The return value equals the sum of getOutflowInVeh(int).

Returns:
total number of vehicles exiting the link in one time step. 0 if something goes wrong.

getInflowInVeh

public java.lang.Double[] getInflowInVeh(int ensemble)
Number of vehicles per vehicle type entering the link during the current time step. The return array is indexed by vehicle type in the order given in the settings portion of the input file.

Returns:
array of entering flows per vehicle type. null if something goes wrong.

getTotalInlowInVeh

public double getTotalInlowInVeh(int ensemble)
Total number of vehicles entering the link during the current time step. The return value equals the sum of getInflowInVeh(int).

Returns:
total number of vehicles entering the link in one time step. 0 if something goes wrong.

computeSpeedInMPS

public double computeSpeedInMPS(int ensemble)
Average speed of traffic in the link in meters/second. The return value is computed by dividing the total outgoing link flow by the total link density.

Returns:
average link speed. 0 if something goes wrong.

setSourcedemandFromVeh

public void setSourcedemandFromVeh(java.lang.Double[] sourcedemand)
Set input flow for source links. [This is API call is being made available for implementation of path-based DTA. The goal is to replace it later with an internal solution.]

overrideDensityWithVeh

public void overrideDensityWithVeh(java.lang.Double[] x,
                                   int ensemble)
Replace link density with given values. [This is API call is being made available for implementation of particle filtering. Use with caution.]
